resources.string: QUIZ\nHow much do you know about Kudīga?

Kuldīga is a town in western Latvia. It is the center of Kuldīga Municipality with a population of approximately 13,500. Kuldīga was first mentioned in 1242. Kuldīga is the pearl of Kurzeme, Latvia\'s western region. It is an ancient town with unique, distinctive architecture. The small River Alekšupīte runs through the very centre of the Kuldīga old town, along the walls of the houses. A 4.5 m high waterfall on the Alekšupīte is the highest in Latvia. The pride of Kuldīga is the Venta waterfall, a 240-meter wide natural waterfall which is the widest in Europe. Not far from the waterfall there is the Kuldīga brick bridge built in 1874, one of the longest bridges of this type in Europe.
